intro: Centrolepis monogyna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved centrolepis, is a unique plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Cycadales order, which includes ancient seed plants. The plant has a distinctive appearance with narrow, strap-like leaves and a short, woody stem. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Centrolepis monogyna is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
